person.persName: James R. Hallam (Kenton Co/Campbell Co Lawyer)

body.p: Native of Virginia. Served as a delegate for Grant County to the Kentucky Whig Party Convention in 1852. Chosen by the Convention as an assistant elector for the presidential election of 1852 in Kentucky's tenth congressional district. Worked as a lawyer in Covington and Newport, Kentucky in 1860. Arrested on the charge of treason to the government in Newport in October of 1861. Served as the Commonwealth Attorney pro temp in 1864-1865 for the Kenton Circuit Court.

Spouse: Clain M Hallam
Children: Henry C Hallam, Theodore Hallam, James R Hallam Jr., Orrin Hallam, Frank Hallam
